arrogance: the behaviour of a person when they feel that they are more important than other people, so that they are rude to them or do not consider them
wax: a solid substance that is made from beeswax or from various fats and oils and used for making candles, polish, models, etc. It becomes soft when it is heated.
a soft, sticky yellow-brown substance that is found in your ears
poetic: like or suggesting poetry, especially because it shows imagination and deep feeling
the freedom of artists or writers to change facts in order to make a story, painting, etc. more interesting or beautiful
put aside: to ignore or forget something, usually a feeling or difference of opinion
to stop working on one task in order to start another one
to save something or keep it available to use
ingredient: one of the things from which something is made, especially one of the foods that are used together to make a particular dish
one of the things or qualities that are necessary to make something successful
hog: a pig, especially one that is kept and made fat for eating
a male pig that has been castrated (= had part of its sex organs removed) and is kept for its meat
to do something completely or to the highest degree
pox: a disease spread by sexual contact
a serious disease that caused a high temperature, left permanent marks on the skin and often caused death
crude: in its natural state, before it has been processed or refined
offensive or rude, especially about sex
simple and not very accurate but giving a general idea of something
simply made, not showing much skill or attention to detail
delicate: not strong and easily becoming ill
small and having a beautiful shape or appearance
made or formed in a very careful and detailed way
showing or needing careful or sensitive treatment
intricate: having a lot of different parts and small details that fit together
hastily: very quickly, because you are in a hurry, especially when this has bad results
too quickly, without giving enough thought
scrawl: to write something in a careless untidy way, making it difficult to read
crew: all the people working on a ship, plane, etc.
all the people working on a ship, plane etc. except the officers who are in charge
a group of people with special skills working together
a team of people who row boats in races
the sport of rowing with other people in a boat
a person or team of people who sail boats in races or for pleasure (usually not including the captain)
sail: to travel on water using sails or an engine
to control or travel on a boat with a sail, especially as a sport
to begin a journey on water
to move quickly and smoothly in a particular direction; (of people) to move in a confident manner
to take a risk by doing something that is dangerous or that may be illegal
imprison: to put somebody in a prison or another place from which they cannot escape
harbour: an area of water on the coast, protected from the open sea by strong walls, where ships can shelter
continent: connected with the control of your feelings, especially your desire to have sex
able to control the bladder and bowels
fur: the soft thick mass of hair that grows on the body of some animals
the skin of an animal with the fur still on it, used especially for making clothes
an artificial material that looks and feels like fur
a piece of clothing, especially a coat or jacket, made of real or artificial fur
a hard grey-white substance that is sometimes left inside water pipes and containers for heating water
a grey-white layer that forms on a person’s tongue, especially when they are ill
silk: fine soft thread produced by silkworms
a type of fine smooth cloth made from silk thread; a piece of this cloth
thread made of silk used for sewing
clothes made of silk, especially the coloured shirts worn by people riding horses in a race (= jockeys)
a type of lawyer who represents the government (= a King’s Counsel / Queen’s Counsel)
(you won't) succeed in making something good out of material that does not seem very good at all
silkworm: a caterpillar (= a small creature like a worm with legs) that produces silk thread
illustrious: very famous and much admired, especially because of what you have achieved
sketch: a simple picture that is drawn quickly and does not have many details
a short funny scene on television, in the theatre, etc.
a short report or story that gives only basic details about something
caption: words that are printed below a picture, cartoon, etc. that explain or describe it
pen: an instrument made of plastic or metal used for writing with ink (= coloured liquid for writing, etc.)
a small piece of land surrounded by a fence in which farm animals are kept
a penalty (= a chance to score a goal without any defending players, except the goalkeeper, trying to stop it)
people who write books, poems, etc. have a greater effect on history and human affairs than soldiers and wars
to write or start to write something
a small mistake in something that you write or say
devotion: great love, care and support for somebody/something
the action of spending a lot of time or energy on something
heretic: a person who believes in or practises religious heresy
heresy: a belief or an opinion that is against the principles of a particular religion; the fact of holding such beliefs
a belief or an opinion that disagrees strongly with what most people believe
inhabit: to live in a particular place
stuck: unable to move or to be moved
in an unpleasant situation or place that you cannot escape from
unable to answer or understand something
not knowing what to do in a particular situation
unable to get rid of somebody/something that you do not want
to be unable to change something that you have been doing the same way for a long time and that has become boring
not having changed at all from a time in the past although everything else has
in a situation where you have to choose between two things, both of which are unpleasant
to start doing something in an enthusiastic way, especially to start eating
in a way that keeps repeating a statement or opinion in an annoying way
transcend: to be or go beyond the usual limits of something
blasphemous: showing a lack of respect for God or religion
flesh: the soft substance between the skin and bones of animal or human bodies
the skin of the human body
the soft part of fruit and vegetables, especially when it is eaten
the human body when considering its physical and sexual needs, rather than the mind or soul
when you say that somebody is flesh and blood, you mean that they are a normal human with needs, emotions and weaknesses
a person that you are related to
if you see somebody in the flesh, you are in the same place as them and actually see them rather than just seeing a picture of them
to make you feel afraid or full of horror
the full amount that somebody owes you, even if this will cause them trouble or difficulty
to say hello to people by shaking hands
to develop a basic idea, etc. by giving more details to make it more complete
you intend to do good things but you are too lazy, weak or busy to actually do them
a person or thing that repeatedly annoys somebody or stops them from doing something
